svt_i2c_master_monitor_def_cov_callback Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_i2c_master_monitor_def_cov_callback:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class is extended from the coverage data callback class. This class includes default cover groups.


Public Member Functions

function void  new ( svt_i2c_configuration cfg , string name = "svt_i2c_master_monitor_def_cov_callback" )

Member CoverGroup Documentation

  covergroup
 svt_i2c_master_monitor_def_cov_callback::master_xacts

Covergroup : master_xacts

Coverpoints :

  • command : Captures the command sent by master (READ, WRITE or GENERAL CALL)
  • addr_10_bit : Captures whether master has sent 7bit or 10bit slave address
  • data_size : Captures the number of data bytes transmitted
  • start_byte : Captures whether START BYTE is sent or not
  • sr_or_p_gen : Captures whether master sends REPEATED START or STOP after getting NACK from slave
  • second_byte_gen_call : Captures the value of second byte of GEN_CALL
  • slave_address_7bit : Captures 7-bit slave addresses
  • slave_address_10bit : Captures 10-bit slave addresses
  • cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p_7bit : Cross coverpoint of command, start byte, sr_or_p with 7-bit address
  • cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p_10bit : Cross coverpoint of command, start byte, sr_or_p with 10-bit address
  • cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p : Cross coverpoint of command, start byte and sr_or_p (including GENERAL CALL)
covergroup master_xacts @ ( xact_event ) ;
                           option.per_instance = 1;
    option.comment = "This covergroup captures coverage of master transaction variables";
     command : coverpoint xact.cmd
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures coverage of commands sent by master";
      bins write_cmd = {0};
      bins read_cmd = {1};
      bins gen_call_cmd = {2};
      bins device_id_cmd = {3};
    }
     addr_10_bit : coverpoint xact.addr_10bit
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether slave address is 7bit or 10bit";
      bins addr_10_bit_0 = {0};
      bins addr_10_bit_1 = {1};
    }
     data_size : coverpoint xact.data.size()
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures the number of data bytes transmitted";
      bins data_size_min_range = {[1:15]};
      bins data_size_mid_range = {[16:30]};
      bins data_size_max_range = {[31:$]};
    }
     start_byte : coverpoint xact.send_start_byte
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether START BYTE is sent or not";
      bins start_byte_0 = {0};
      bins start_byte_1 = {1};
    }
          sr_or_p_gen : coverpoint xact.sr_or_p_gen
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether REPEATED START or STOP is sent after getting NACK from slave";
      bins sr_or_p_gen_0 = {0};
      bins sr_or_p_gen_1 = {1};
    }
     second_byte_gen_call : coverpoint xact.sec_byte_gen_call iff((xact.cmd == 2) && (xact.ack_detected[0] == 1))
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures the value of second byte of GEN_CALL";
      bins second_byte_gen_call_04 = {8'h04};
      bins second_byte_gen_call_06 = {8'h06};
    }
     slave_address_7bit : coverpoint xact.addr[6:0] iff((xact.addr_10bit == 0) && (xact.cmd !== 2))
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures 7-bit slave addresses";
      bins slave0_address = {slave0_add };
      bins slave_address_non_existing = {slave_non_exist};
    }
     slave_address_10bit : coverpoint xact.addr iff(xact.addr_10bit == 1)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures 10-bit slave addresses";
      bins slave1_address = { 10'b1100110000};
      bins slave_address_non_existing = { 10'b1111110011};
    }
     cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p_7bit : cross command, start_byte, sr_or_p_gen, slave_address_7bit
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures cross coverage of command, start byte, sr_or_p with 7-bit address";
      ignore_bins exclude_gen_call_bins = binsof(command.gen_call_cmd);
      ignore_bins exclude_deviceid_bins = binsof(command.device_id_cmd);
    }
    // ignoring the invalid cross bins of deviceid, general call and read in 10bit addressing for non existing slave
    cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p_10bit : cross command, start_byte, sr_or_p_gen, slave_address_10bit
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures cross coverage of command, start byte, sr_or_p with 10-bit address";
      ignore_bins exclude_gen_call_bins = binsof(command.gen_call_cmd);
      ignore_bins exclude_deviceid_bins = binsof(command.device_id_cmd);
      ignore_bins exclude_rd_startbyte_10bit_bins = binsof(command.read_cmd)
                                                 && binsof(slave_address_10bit.slave_address_non_existing)
                                                 && binsof(start_byte)
                                                 && binsof(sr_or_p_gen) ;
    }
         cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p : cross command, start_byte, sr_or_p_gen
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures cross coverage of command, start byte and sr_or_p (including GENERAL CALL)";
      ignore_bins exclude_deviceid_bins = binsof(command.device_id_cmd);
    }
   endgroup

  covergroup
 svt_i2c_master_monitor_def_cov_callback::scenario_sequence

Covergroup : scenario_sequence

Coverpoints :

  • command_seq : Captures the scenario WRITE followed by READ followed by GENERAL CALL WRITE-->READ-->GENERAL CALL
  • addr_7b_10b : Captures whether master has sent 7bit slave address followed by 10bit slave address
  • write_7b_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (10 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (10 bit addresssing)
  • write_7b_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_7b_read_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by READ command (10 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_read_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by READ command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_7b_read_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by READ command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_read_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by READ command (10 bit addresssing)
covergroup scenario_sequence @ ( seq_match_event ) ;
     option.per_instance = 1;
    option.comment = "This covergroup captures sequence of scenarios";
     command_seq : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures the scenario WRITE followed by READ followed by GENERAL CALL";
      bins cmd_seq = {CMD_SEQ};
    }
     addr_7b_10b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent 7bit slave address followed by 10bit slave address";
      bins addr_7b_10b_seq = {ADDR_7B_10B_SEQ};
    }
     write_7b_10b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (10 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_7b_10b_seq = {WRITE_7B_10B_SEQ};
    }
     write_10b_7b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (7 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_10b_7b_seq = {WRITE_10B_7B_SEQ};
    }
     write_10b_10b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (10 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_10b_10b_seq = {WRITE_10B_10B_SEQ};
    }
     write_7b_7b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (7 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_7b_7b_seq = {WRITE_7B_7B_SEQ};
    }
     write_7b_read_10b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by READ command (10 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_7b_read_10b_seq = {WRITE_7B_READ_10B_SEQ};
    }
     write_10b_read_7b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by READ command (7 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_10b_read_7b_seq = {WRITE_10B_READ_7B_SEQ};
    }
     write_7b_read_7b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by READ command (7 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_7b_read_7b_seq = {WRITE_7B_READ_7B_SEQ};
    }
     write_10b_read_10b : coverpoint(seq_match_type)
    {
      option.comment = "This coverpoint captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by READ command (10 bit addresssing)";
      bins write_10b_read_10b_seq = {WRITE_10B_READ_10B_SEQ};
    }
   endgroup
